pullRequest.body:
This PR makes it so that the existing string-based nonterminal simp linter will not trigger when a simp is followed by one of a few "flexible" tactics.

See [this](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/False.20ERR_NSP.20positive/near/437054148) thread for discussion of places where this linter was being too sensitive.

Most of the list was decided by poll [here](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/.60simp.60.20followers).

---

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9407815369/job/25914426945)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9407815369/job/25914427219)
Clear change: I presume (but haven't checked) that this list matches the "flexible tactics" discussed on zulip.
Clear change: I presume (but haven't checked) that this list matches the "flexible tactics" discussed on zulip.

If the content of this list was determined on zulip, can you please add a link to that discussion in a comment?

Personally, I think `rfl` is not very flexible. Otoh, `linarith` and `nlinarith` probably are?

See [this](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/False.20ERR_NSP.20positive/near/437054148) thread for discussion of places where this linter was being too sensitive.

Most of the list was decided by poll [here](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/.60simp.60.20followers).

[Here](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/nonterminal.20simp.20then.20rfl/near/394744033) is the link where Kim said `rfl` was ok. Note that this PR does not change the status of `rfl` with regards to the linter.
Seems `linarith` and `nlinarith` were not included in the poll, I'll just add them now.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: add flexible tactics to nonterminal simp linter
